Iris Encourages Priam to Beg the Body of Hector from Achilles

value: Iris flies besides the walking Priam; a view into a room with sleeping Trojans is at left; the camp of the Greeks is shown in the right middle plane; Thetis approaches Achilles who sits behind the body of Hector who is fastened to his chariot.

Decoration of the Top of a Niche

label: Description
value: A cherub is over the center of the niche. Convex entablature with broken pediment. A putto holds an ermine mantling. Another putto seated upon a cornice raises a wreath.

label: Physical description
value: Pen, brown ink, Chinese black washes, and traces of graphite

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: A ground floor window is framed by a central console, a herm supported entablature, and half-figure supported pediment. In the center of the pediment is an indistinct coat-of-arms. The lower part of the window is closed by a railing. The main frieze of which represents a lyre framed by scrolls. A women, in profile, leans upon the railing.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil, pen, brush, and dark water color.

Design for a door with arched pediment

label: Description
